meanings.definition: To move on hands and knees.
meanings.sent1: The baby was becrawling across the floor to reach his toy.
meanings.sent2: The explorer had to becrawling through the narrow cave entrance.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was becrawling towards its owner, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The vines were becrawling up the old stone wall, creating a beautiful green pattern.
meanings.sent5: The soldier was becrawling silently towards the enemy camp, trying to remain undetected.

meanings.definition: To cover or swarm over something.
meanings.sent1: The ants were becrawling all over the picnic blanket, searching for crumbs.
meanings.sent2: During the festival, people would becrawling the streets, celebrating and dancing.
meanings.sent3: The kids were becrawling the playground equipment, laughing and playing together.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were becrawling the sky, threatening to bring rain.
meanings.sent5: The ivy was becrawling the old abandoned house, giving it a mysterious look.

meanings.sent1: The snail was becrawling along the garden path, leaving a shiny trail behind.
meanings.sent2: The traffic was becrawling along the highway due to the accident.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar was becrawling up the tall plant, munching on leaves as it went.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be becrawling as the students waited for the bell to ring.
meanings.sent5: The glacier was becrawling down the mountain, reshaping the landscape slowly over centuries.
